intro: Heptapleurum corona-sylvae, commonly known as the cloud forest heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Actinidiaceae. It is native to the humid, high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in countries like Vietnam and Laos. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and is often found in shaded, moist environments within cloud forests. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are typically followed by dark blue berries. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
